LOUISVILLE TAKES OFF AFTER DERBY 151

Each year on the first Saturday in May,

extravagantly dressed spectators gather at

Churchill Downs in Louisville for "the most exciting two minutes in sports". Known as the “Run for the Roses” for the blanket of over 400 red roses awarded to the winner, the Kentucky Derby is the oldest continuously held sporting event in the United States. In its 151st running on May 3, 2025, Sovereignty brought home the

roses after completing 1¼ miles in 2 minutes and 2 seconds, defeating favorite Journalism. The following day, Louisville Muhammad Ali International Airport reported nearly 18,500 departing seats across 117 flights, making Sunday, May 4 the airport's busiest day of 2025. The record is a testament to the Derby’s magnetic pull on travelers from across the nation.

Cartography by Chiara Phillips, 2025. Sources: FlightRadar24 (commercial and private jets), KentuckyDerby.com, FlyLouisville.com
